definition: to begin work (of a factory or engineering operation)/to start a construction job

to open/to start/to turn on/to boil/to write out (a prescription, check, invoice etc)/to operate (a vehicle)/carat (gold)/abbr. for Kelvin, 開爾文|开尔文[Kai1 er3 wen2]/abbr. for 開本|开本[kai1 ben3], book format
work/worker/skill/profession/trade/craft/labor

sentences.english: The land has been confiscated and all the formalities are ready for starting construction.
sentences.chinese: 该项目土地已征迁，各项手续齐备，可开工建设。

sentences.english: The deal was agreed last year and construction is expected to begin soon.
sentences.chinese: 这项输油管道协议去年达成，修筑工程预计很快开工。

sentences.english: Consider housing starts, which have fallen to their lowest level in 50 years.
sentences.chinese: 考虑到住房建设开工已经降到50年来的最低水平。

sentences.english: Show the repair quotation and breakdown to insurer before commencing.
sentences.chinese: 维修估价单位必须先交保险公司比准后方可开工修理。

sentences.english: "Waiting for Ah Mu" became a typical procedure of working with Anita Mui.
sentences.chinese: 变成和梅艳芳开工的例牌工序。

sentences.english: The photo shows the construction commencement ceremony of the Dali Highway.
sentences.chinese: 图为大理至丽江高速公路开工奠基仪式。

sentences.english: Please get the dunnage materials prepared, otherwise we can't work tonight.
sentences.chinese: 请把垫舱物料准备好，否则今晚我们不能开工。

sentences.english: The first estimate shall be submitted within 42 days after the Commencement Date.
sentences.chinese: 每一次估算应在开工日期后42天内提交。

sentences.english: China will strictly control new projects this year
sentences.chinese: 中国今年将严格控制新开工项目。

sentences.english: The ground-breaking is expected some time in the second half of this year.
sentences.chinese: 广珠城际快速轨道有望今年下半年开工。

sentences.english: To make the machine work, just press the 'on' switch.
sentences.chinese: 只需按下开关，吸入式食物机就开工了。

sentences.english: Some Leaders from the Ministry of Education and local government attended the ceremony.
sentences.chinese: 教育部和北京市有关领导出席了开工典礼。

sentences.english: We went out to buy more wood, and he set to work at once.
sentences.chinese: 我们又出去买了更多的木料，他马上就开工了。

sentences.english: This article introduced the commissioning experience of crude benzol-escaping air recovery system.
sentences.chinese: 介绍了焦化厂粗苯放散气体回收系统开工调试的经验。

sentences.english: Will be started soon in the county of Beijing-Shanghai high-speed railway stations within its own boundaries.
sentences.chinese: 即将开工的京沪高速铁路在我县境内设有车站。

sentences.english: Wherever the sun set, pilferers worked to satisfy China's hunger.
sentences.chinese: 哪里太阳下山，哪里就有小偷为满足中国的饥渴开工。

definition: to start (a building project)
to finish work/to complete a project
to complete a project
to return to work (after stoppage)
to stop work/to shut down/to stop production
to put into production/to put into operation
time allocated for a project/completion date
to open to traffic (e.g. new bridge, rail line etc)/(of a locality) to have a transportation service/(Tw) to commute
to establish/to build
engineering/an engineering project/project/undertaking/CL:個|个[ge4],項|项[xiang4]
construction/to carry out construction or large-scale repairs
to lay railway track
to invite bids
to construct under contract
new construction/newly built
Xinjian county in Nanchang 南昌, Jiangxi
to dig out/to excavate/to scoop out
